title: Installation does not work
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/235

After carrying out your installation instructions I get the following error message when using jupyter-notebook:

I 20:08:43.612 NotebookApp] KernelRestarter: restarting kernel (1/5), keep random ports
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\Jonas\.conda\envs\lf2\lib\runpy.py", line 183, in _run_module_as_main
    mod_name, mod_spec, code = _get_module_details(mod_name, _Error)
  File "C:\Users\Jonas\.conda\envs\lf2\lib\runpy.py", line 142, in _get_module_details
    return _get_module_details(pkg_main_name, error)
  File "C:\Users\Jonas\.conda\envs\lf2\lib\runpy.py", line 109, in _get_module_details
    __import__(pkg_name)
  File "C:\Users\Jonas\.conda\envs\lf2\lib\site-packages\fortran_kernel\__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
    from .kernel import FortranKernel
  File "C:\Users\Jonas\.conda\envs\lf2\lib\site-packages\fortran_kernel\kernel.py", line 12, in <module>
    from lfortran.ast import dump, SyntaxErrorException
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'lfortran'

I used conda. I also installed: conda_install_-c_conda-forge_c-compiler

I would really like to test your lfortran.
Kind regards,
Jonas
